customer_name: COLUMBUS AND FRANKLIN COUNTY METRO PARK DIST
site_name: COLUMBUS AND FRANKLIN COUNTY METRO PARK DISTRICT

citations.narrative:
An enclosure at the facility failed to contain part of the bison herd. The facility self-reported to the APHIS inspector that on
7/27/24, 6 of the 13 bison exited the enclosure by rubbing on the gate and inadvertently snapping the cable locking the
gate. A park ranger stayed on site to monitor the situation while additional resources were alerted. Within 2 hours, the
bison were all rounded up by the park rangers and lured into a secured pasture by using treats. There were no human or
animal injuries that occurred from this incidence. It is unclear at the time of inspection what caused the bison to rub on the
gate. Since the day of the incident, the facility has repaired the gate and cable lock in order to prevent this occurrence
from happening again. The bison herd was also moved to an alternate pasture.
Correct by ensuring the enclosure be constructed of materials of such strength that is appropriate to safely contain the
animals housed within. Correct from 8/7/24 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
